bibl.title: From Cave to Monastery: Transformations at the Nome Frontier of Gebel el-Haridi in Upper Egypt.
bibl.note: Gebel el-Haridi as a Political Boundary [between the Antaeopolite and Panopolite nomes]. - The Field Project. - The Caverns and Quarries. - The Mud-brick Structures. - The Pottery from GAN [Gebel Abu el-Nasr] 1. - The Mud-brick Structures below Quarry E (GAN 2). - Finds and Pottery from GAN 2. - Late Antiquity at Gebel el-Haridi: A Cultural Frontier.

bibl.title: Shifting Frontiers in Late Antiquity. [Papers of the First Interdisciplinary Conference on Late Antiquity, The University of Kansas, March, 1995]

bibl.seg: KIRBY Christopher J. and Sara E. OREL, From Cave to Monastery: Transformations at the Nome Frontier of Gebel el-Haridi in Upper Egypt.

Ralph W. MATHISEN and Hagith S. SIVAN (Edd.), Shifting Frontiers in Late Antiquity. [Papers of the First Interdisciplinary Conference on Late Antiquity, The University of Kansas, March, 1995] (Aldershot, 1995) pp. 201-214, 3 figg.

Gebel el-Haridi as a Political Boundary [between the Antaeopolite and Panopolite nomes]. - The Field Project. - The Caverns and Quarries. - The Mud-brick Structures. - The Pottery from GAN [Gebel Abu el-Nasr] 1. - The Mud-brick Structures below Quarry E (GAN 2). - Finds and Pottery from GAN 2. - Late Antiquity at Gebel el-Haridi: A Cultural Frontier.
